Package org.onyxplatform.api.java

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    OnyxNames
    Abstracts use of and centralizes location of onyx keywords.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    API
    Simple public facing user API mirroring all functionality of underlaying onyx API.
    Catalog
    A catalog holds a set of tasks which can be passed to and run in a job.
    EnvConfiguration
    An EnvConfiguration (environment configuration) specifies how a development environment should be initialized, which uses an in-memory implementation of zookeeper.
    FlowCondition
    Flow conditions are used for isolating logic about whether or not segments should pass through different tasks in a workflow, and support a rich degree of composition with runtime parameterization.
    FlowConditions
    FlowConditions objects are a set of FlowCondition objects that can be applied to Tasks running as part of a job.
    Job
    A job is the collection of a workflow, catalog, flow conditions, lifecycles, and execution parameters.
    Lifecycle
    There are several interesting points to execute arbitrary code during a task in Onyx.
    Lifecycles
    Lifecycles objects are a set of Lifecycle objects that can be applied to Tasks running as part of a job.
    OnyxEnv  
    OnyxMap
    Serves as a base for any Onyx concept that is represented only by a map.
    OnyxVector
    Serves as a base for any Onyx concept that is represented by a vector of onyx maps, e.g.
    PeerConfiguration
    A peer configuration specifies the set of system parameters that will be used for all peers on a given machine.
    Task
    A task specifies a map that represents a single onyx unit of work.
    TaskScheduler
    The purpose of the task scheduler is to control the order in which available peers are allocated to which tasks.
    Trigger
    Triggers are a feature that interact with Windows.
    Triggers
    Triggers are a set of Trigger objects that can be collectively applied to a window or windows associated with an onyx job.
    Window
    Windows allow you to group and accrue data into possibly overlapping buckets.
    Windows
    Windows objects are a set of Window objects that can be used for a given job.
    Workflow
    A workflow is the structural specification of an Onyx program.
